meanings.definition: A shady, leafy shelter or recess
meanings.sent1: The children played hide-and-seek in the boweries of the park.
meanings.sent2: The boweries in the garden provided a cool spot to relax on hot days.
meanings.sent3: The cat found a cozy spot among the boweries of the bushes to take a nap.
meanings.sent4: The boweries of the forest whispered secrets to those who listened.
meanings.sent5: The boweries swayed gently in the breeze, creating a peaceful atmosphere.

meanings.sent1: The old cabin in the woods served as a boweries for the hermit.
meanings.sent2: The boweries by the lake was a perfect escape from the city hustle.
meanings.sent3: The travelers stumbled upon a charming boweries hidden deep in the forest.
meanings.sent4: The quaint boweries nestled among the hills seemed like a place from a fairytale.
meanings.sent5: The cozy boweries was a haven for those seeking solitude and peace.

meanings.definition: A cluster of trees or shrubs
meanings.sent1: The boweries of colorful flowers attracted butterflies and bees.
meanings.sent2: The boweries along the riverbank provided a natural habitat for birds.
meanings.sent3: The dense boweries shielded the animals from the harsh sunlight.
meanings.sent4: The boweries of cherry blossoms painted a beautiful picture in the garden.
meanings.sent5: The boweries of pine trees emitted a refreshing scent in the forest.

meanings.definition: A pleasant rural or suburban area
meanings.sent1: The small town nestled in the boweries was a peaceful place to live.
meanings.sent2: The boweries of the countryside were dotted with charming cottages.
meanings.sent3: The boweries around the lake were a popular spot for picnics.
meanings.sent4: The boweries of the neighborhood bloomed with community gardens.
meanings.sent5: The boweries of the village were alive with the sounds of nature.
